issues.description: The UML diagram in the problem statement names the class as ‘Course’ but everywhere else (text, template, solution) it is called ‘Lecture’. This mismatch could confuse students about the correct class name to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the UML diagram’s class declaration from `class Course` to `class Lecture` so it matches the described and provided code.

issues.description: The UML diagram in the problem statement defines the class as 'Course', whereas the exercise description and both the template and solution code refer to the class as 'Lecture'. This naming mismatch can confuse students about which class name they should use.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class in the UML diagram from 'Course' to 'Lecture' in the problem statement so that it consistently matches the template and solution code.
